title: Trump's choice: Yield to China or raise trade tariffs and pave the way for Fed's easing
text: The German trade surplus is stifling the economic growth in the rest of Europe, Michael Ivanovitch writes.

title: US-Japan trade and the auto sector will be high on Abe's agenda as he claims victory at the polls
text: Japan's prime minister and his coalition won a majority of the upper house elections on Sunday, but couldn't secure enough votes to revise the constitution.

title: Recession threat is rising as earnings roll over, market bear David Rosenberg warns
text: Gluskin Sheff's David Rosenberg is painting a painful picture for stocks as earnings season goes into full gear.

title: The Week Ahead: With All Eyes On Earnings Watch These Two Stocks
text: The late Friday market decline put more pressure on stocks this week as a large number of S&P 500 companies are scheduled to report. There are two stocks that Tom Aspray examines from a technical aspect and he thinks they may hold the key as to how the market closes the week.

title: Big Tech’s antitrust suspects enter earnings spotlight, along with Boeing and Tesla
text: Busiest week of the season includes three of the tech companies being investigated by feds.

title: IPO Outlook For The Week: Biotech, Health Analytics, Sports And Solar Power
text: For a more comprehensive IPO calendar, check out the offering in Benzinga Cloud. The IPO dates below are expected but not confirmed.

title: Academically I'm Dovish, But Professionally I'm Bullish?
text: The NY Fed's Williams tried to walk back a dovish speech, saying it was an academic speech and not a policy speech. That makes no sense to me, as you would think the 2 go hand in hand.

title: Why The Federal Reserve Shouldn't Cut Rates Until Quantitative Tightening Ends
text: Most on Wall Street expect the Federal Reserve to cut the federal funds rate by 25 or 50 basis points on July 31.This isn't a wise move.

title: Dow, S&P 500 And Nasdaq Set New Highs Early Last Week Then Faded
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S and P 500 and Nasdaq Composite remain below their third quarter risky levels.

title: How to Invest in the Best Texas Stocks
text: You'll want to pick your own Texas-based stocks, and following this simple strategy will give you a portfolio you can be proud of.

title: From a fake George Soros fund to cloud-controlled robots, Chinese IPOs are getting even scarier
text: Latest risky filings move beyond copycats of U.S. tech firms to companies that are frightening beyond just their sketchy corporate structures and finances.

title: Banks Are The Largest Holders Worldwide Of Leveraged Loans And Collateralized Loan Obligations
text: Irrespective of what lobbyists, politicians, or even regulators might say, banks own over half of leveraged loans and CLOs globally. In a downturn, growing illiquidity in these products would force banks to raise capital buffers, possibly leading to fire sales, not only of CLOs but other assets.

title: Copper Has Hit The Low Point In Its Cycle-Higher Prices Are Coming
text: In this follow up to the spring copper forecast, the projected rally is underway.

title: With stocks at all-time highs, here's how to navigate earnings season using ETFs
text: With earnings season in full swing, exchange-traded fund experts Tom Lydon and Ric Edelman share their takes on the top ways to play the upcoming reports.

title: Margrethe Vestager scares the tech giants. If we leave the EU, we’ll miss her
text: The greatest economic threat facing Europe is of falling hopelessly behind the US and China in adopting the next generation of technology. That is the view of many across Europe’s industrial and financial sectors who watch with wonder the proxy battle between the US and Chinese administrations on behalf of their tech giants.

title: Government telecoms review to soft-pedal on Huawei
text: A long-awaited government review will fudge taking a critical decision on controversial Chinese technology company Huawei being allowed to build 5G networks in the UK.
